news.title: Twitter to Launch a “Hide Replies” Feature, Plus Other Changes to Its Reporting Process
news.description: As part of a host of new measures intended to counter abuse on its platform, Twitter announced that it is experimenting with a new “hide replies” feature that will allow users to have more control over the comments that appear along with their tweets. Rather than simply blocking, muting, or reporting the commenter, users can hide those replies, though others can still click through an additional menu to view the hidden content.

news.title: Researchers Unearth 74 Facebook Cybercrime Groups With 385,000 Members
news.description: A Cisco security group has conducted research revealing dozens of Facebook groups dedicated to facilitating illegal activity, and whose membership numbers are in the hundreds of thousands. Facebook’s abuse-reporting systems were only marginally effective in removing the groups, and once some are removed, others appear in their places.

news.title: Jack Dorsey Says It’s Time to Rethink the Fundamental Dynamics of Twitter
news.description: At a recent TED event, Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey fielded questions regarding the company’s failure to consistently ban hate groups and other harmful content. He suggested that moving forward, it may be best to de-emphasize the importance of followers and likes, and restructure the platform to cater more to users’ interests, regardless of who posts the relevant content.
